episodeTitle: Beat Kuro! Usopp the Man's Tearful Resolve!
episodeTitleJapanese: クロを倒せ！男ウソップ涙の決意！
episodeTitleRomanized: Kuro o taose! Otoko Usoppu namida no ketsui!
description: The battle against Captain Kuro and the Black Cat Pirates reaches its climax. Luffy continues his intense fight against Kuro, showcasing his rubber powers with new techniques. Meanwhile, Zoro faces off against the hypnotically-strengthened Buchi, and Jango pursues the fleeing Kaya through the forest. Usopp shows his determination to protect his village despite overwhelming odds.

events.title: Luffy vs Kuro Battle Intensifies
events.description: The battle between Luffy and Captain Kuro reaches its peak intensity. Kuro demonstrates his incredible speed using his Nuki Ashi technique, making it difficult for Luffy to land hits. The clash represents Luffy's determination to protect Usopp's village against Kuro's ruthless ambition.
events.significance: This battle showcases Luffy's growth as a fighter and his willingness to risk everything to protect his friends and their homes. It also reveals Kuro's true personality as a cold-blooded strategist willing to sacrifice anyone for his plans.

quotes.text: I don't care about your plans. I won't let you hurt this village or Usopp!
quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy declares his resolve to defeat Kuro

events.title: Gomu Gomu no Yari First Use
events.description: Luffy debuts a new technique called Gomu Gomu no Yari (Rubber Rubber Spear), where he holds his feet together and kicks with both simultaneously, creating a powerful spear-like attack. He uses this technique against Kuro after dodging one of his lightning-fast strikes.
events.significance: This marks the debut of one of Luffy's signature techniques and demonstrates his ability to adapt and develop new moves during battle. The spear attack becomes part of Luffy's core fighting arsenal.

quotes.speaker: Luffy
quotes.context: Luffy's first use of the Gomu Gomu no Yari technique

events.title: Kuro's Retirement Plan Revealed
events.description: Kuro explains his elaborate three-year plan to retire from piracy. Tired of being constantly hunted by the Marines, he faked his own execution by having his crew member hypnotized to impersonate him. He then infiltrated Syrup Village as the butler Klahadore, planning to inherit Kaya's fortune and live a peaceful, wealthy life.
events.significance: This revelation showcases the depth of Kuro's cunning and patience, establishing him as one of the most intelligent villains in the East Blue. It also reveals his contempt for the pirate lifestyle despite his success, contrasting sharply with Luffy's passionate embrace of being a pirate.

quotes.text: Three years I've spent playing the part of a loyal butler. Three years of patience for a peaceful retirement with wealth!
quotes.speaker: Kuro
quotes.context: Kuro reveals his long-term plan to Luffy

events.title: Zoro vs Hypnotically-Enhanced Buchi
events.description: Zoro faces off against Buchi, one of the Nyaban Brothers, who has been hypnotically enhanced by Jango. Under hypnosis, Buchi's strength and ferocity are amplified, making him a more dangerous opponent. Despite his injuries from earlier battles, Zoro accepts the challenge.
events.significance: This battle tests Zoro's resolve and combat skills against an enhanced opponent while he's already wounded. It demonstrates his unwavering determination and fighting spirit, key characteristics that make him Luffy's first mate.

events.title: Kuro's Nuki Ashi Speed Demonstrated
events.description: Kuro fully demonstrates his Nuki Ashi (Stealth Foot) technique, moving at superhuman speeds that make him appear to teleport. He can cover approximately 100 meters in 4-5 seconds, making him nearly impossible to track with the naked eye. This technique is a precursor to the later-revealed Soru technique.
events.significance: This showcases one of the most impressive non-Devil Fruit speed techniques seen in the East Blue, establishing that incredible abilities can be achieved through pure training and skill. It demonstrates the level of threat that skilled fighters pose, even without supernatural powers.

events.title: Usopp's Tearful Determination
events.description: Despite being outmatched and terrified, Usopp stands his ground to protect Kaya and his village. With tears streaming down his face, he declares his resolve to fight the Black Cat Pirates, embodying the episode's title. Though he trembles with fear, he refuses to run away.
events.significance: This moment defines Usopp's character - he's not fearless, but he's brave enough to fight despite his fear when protecting those he cares about. It establishes the core of his character arc and demonstrates that courage isn't the absence of fear, but acting despite it.

quotes.text: I may be a coward... but I won't run away when my friends need me!
quotes.speaker: Usopp
quotes.context: Usopp's declaration of resolve despite his fear

events.title: Zoro Defeats Buchi
events.description: Despite Buchi's hypnotically-enhanced strength, Zoro defeats him using his superior swordsmanship and tactical thinking. After a fierce exchange, Zoro lands a decisive blow that takes Buchi out of the fight, eliminating one of the Black Cat Pirates' strongest fighters.
events.significance: This victory demonstrates Zoro's growth as a swordsman and his ability to overcome enhanced opponents even while injured. It removes a major threat from the battlefield and allows Zoro to assist with other battles.

events.title: Jango Pursues Kaya
events.description: After Kaya manages to escape the mansion, Jango pursues her through the forest with the intent to capture or harm her according to Kuro's plan. This chase puts Kaya in immediate danger and raises the stakes of the battle, as her safety becomes a time-sensitive matter.
events.significance: This escalates the urgency of the situation and splits the heroes' attention between multiple threats. It shows Kuro's ruthlessness in pursuing his plan and puts innocent lives at immediate risk, emphasizing why the Straw Hats must win quickly.

events.title: Kuro's High IQ Mentioned
events.description: It's revealed that Kuro possesses the second highest IQ in the East Blue (second only to Benn Beckman of the Red-Haired Pirates). This intelligence is what allowed him to create such elaborate plans and maintain his cover as Klahadore for three years.
events.significance: This establishes that the One Piece world contains individuals with exceptional intelligence who can rival even Devil Fruit users through pure cunning and planning. It foreshadows that not all threats in the series will be purely physical.

events.title: Contrast Between Kuro and Luffy's Pirate Philosophy
events.description: The episode highlights the fundamental difference between Kuro and Luffy's approach to piracy. While Kuro sees being a pirate as a burden he wants to escape, Luffy embraces it with joy and passion. This philosophical clash defines their battle as much as their physical conflict.
events.significance: This establishes one of the series' core themes - that one's approach to their dreams and way of life matters as much as achieving them. It foreshadows future conflicts between those who see piracy as a means to an end versus those who see it as a way of life.

themes.description: The episode explores how true courage isn't the absence of fear, but the willingness to act despite it. Usopp embodies this by standing up to the Black Cat Pirates even while trembling with terror.
themes.symbolism: Usopp's tears represent his fear, but his stance represents his courage - the two coexist and the courage is made more meaningful by the fear.

themes.description: The philosophical clash between Luffy's passionate embrace of piracy and Kuro's desire to escape it highlights the importance of loving one's chosen path. Kuro's intelligence and planning are ultimately undermined by his lack of genuine passion.
themes.symbolism: Kuro's elaborate plan represents empty ambition without heart, while Luffy's straightforward approach represents genuine passion.

themes.description: Despite Kuro having the second highest IQ in the East Blue and creating meticulous plans, he's ultimately challenged by Luffy's heart-driven determination and genuine care for his friends.
themes.symbolism: Kuro's cat claws represent cold calculation, while Luffy's rubber body represents flexibility and resilience.

mangaDifferences.difference: The anime extends some battle sequences between Luffy and Kuro compared to the manga chapters, adding more back-and-forth exchanges to fill the episode runtime.
Additional dialogue was added to further explain Kuro's retirement plan and his feelings about being a pirate, making his motivations more explicit for anime viewers.

trivia.fact: The Gomu Gomu no Yari technique that debuts in this episode becomes one of Luffy's signature moves, appearing frequently throughout the series.

sources.title: Gomu Gomu no Mi Techniques - One Piece Wiki

trivia.fact: Kuro's Nuki Ashi technique is considered a precursor to the CP9's Soru technique that appears much later in the series. Both involve rapid leg movements to achieve incredible speed.
This episode is based on manga chapters 35-37, which are part of the Syrup Village arc that runs from chapters 23-41.
Kōichi Hashimoto, who voices Kuro in Japanese, is known for voicing calculating and intelligent characters in various anime series.
The episode's air date of February 23, 2000 was part of the original continuous run of One Piece that began in October 1999.
